Detailed Description

Handles communication via uart (polling mode). Is only included if compiled with -DDEBUG_UART.

Author:
Dirk Opfer, Matthias Fechner
Date:
Fri Oct 26 17:18:15 2007

Define Documentation

#define BAUD   38400L

baud rate, the L at the end is important, DO NOT use UL!

#define DEBUG_MSG_MAX_LEN   MSG_MAX_DATA_LENGTH-2

max length a debug message can have

Referenced by AppendToQueue().

Function Documentation

static uint8_t AppendToQueue ( struct msg *  current,
uint8_t  character 
) [static]

Take the given char and append it to a debug message queue (return 1).

If 0 is return new queue is existing or it is full, you must create the queue outside of this funtion. It is important that IRQs are disabled and enabled after the function to protect the message queue of unwanted touches while be in the function!

That function was written to use the memory for debugging message more efficient.

Parameters:
currentPointer to the message queue
lengthLength of characters to append to the message queue
characterPointer to characters to store in the message queue
Returns:

References uart_cmds::count, uart_cmds::data, msg::data, DEBUG_MSG_MAX_LEN, msg::next, and uart_cmds::offset.

Referenced by uart_putc().

static void trigger_uart ( void   ) [inline, static]

Start the send progress and write all queued data to rs232 interface.

Trigger here the first byte and enable ISQ for sending.

References uart_cmds::data, msg::data, ENABLE_UART_TX_IRQ, MSG_SENDING, uart_cmds::offset, msg::state, and UART_SEND_BYTE.

Referenced by uart_put(), and uart_putc().

void uart_puts ( const char *  s )

Display string on rs232.

The strings are saved on flash and not in sram. See here definition of DEBUG_PUTS on freebus-debug.h.

Parameters:
sString pointer which points to flash

References uart_putc().

Here is the call graph for this function:
